byline.contributor: Shuaib Almosawa reported from Sana, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo.
byline.original: By SHUAIB ALMOSAWA and KAREEM FAHIM

abstract: Militants belonging to Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula seize control of southern Yemen town of Jaar and provincial capital Zinjibar, taking advantage of upheaval there to consolidate control.
lead_paragraph: Fighters again moved to take advantage of turmoil during the country’s civil war, which pits Houthi rebels against an Arab military coalition.

headline.main: Militants From Qaeda Affiliate Seize 2 Yemeni Towns
headline.print_headline: Militants From Qaeda Affiliate Seize 2 Yemeni Towns

snippet: Fighters again moved to take advantage of turmoil during the country’s civil war, which pits Houthi rebels against an Arab military coalition.

keywords.value: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
